metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40304 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in libxml2 before 2.10.3. Certain invalid XMLentity definitions can corrupt a hash table key, potentially leading tosubsequent logic errors. In one case, a double-free can be provoked.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.8
libxml2-utils - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.8
python-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.8
python3-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.8').
